Hi all,

quote from the customer :
{quote}
We are using the 'Enabled Projects' feature of GH. However, the process is time consuming for the users and we want to know if there is any GH API that we can leverage to onboard the new projects and add them under 'Enabled Projects' section of GH.

fields.description:
User would like to abort / cancel a Sprint and remove all history of the Sprint (including from issues tagged in that Sprint)

 Unable to completely remove a sprint, as well delete history records from a related issue(s).
 For further details and to reproduce the error, please follow the procedures below:

# Create a new project and raise new issues on it.
# In the GH global settings, enable the project and select Scrum in template and for Rapid Board
# Set a new Rapid Board to related project
# Create a Sprint and move the previous issue(s) to it.
# Try to find a version in the project (none)
# Check on planning board, no sprint.
# On the issue(s) screen, identify the "Agile" option value (sprint version).
# Delete the Rapid Board created.

The issues will keep the sprint value.
[Here|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-38120] we have a related issue.

Kindly regards,

Paulo Renato
Atlassian support
fields.summary: As a user I would like to completely cancel / abort a Sprint

According to GreenHopper release note - 
bq. The Global Rank field allows ranking by users that have the Schedule Issues permission. There is no longer an option to use the Resolve Issue permission for ranking. 

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+5.8+Upgrade+Notes#GreenHopper58UpgradeNotes-ChangestoRanking

Please update the documentation - http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Ranking+Issues+in+GreenHopper
for the line:
bq. By default the Resolve Issue Permission is used when identifying those users who can rank issue. You can change this to the Schedule Issue Permission if you wish.
fields.summary: Documentation - Ranking issues permission no longer bound to Resolve Issue permission

fields.description: I mistakenly added a task to a sprint. There is no way to move it back to the backlog once the sprint has been started.
fields.summary: It should be possible to move a task from a sprint to the backlog

fields.description:
We need to figure out the how, what and why of flagging scope change in the sprint report. 

We want to flag late additions and punted issues, but we probably also want to show issues which were re-estimated (either up or down).

COS: 
- Issues that were added to the Sprint and not completed should be highlighted in some way in the not completed section (since there was never a promise to do so) 
- Issues that were removed from the Sprint should be shown as not completed but highlighted as deliberately removed (a form of scope change that hopefully happened with agreement amongst the team) 
- Issues that had their estimate changed should have a note indicating what their original estimate was (whether or not they were completed)
fields.summary: Further enhance sprint report

fields.description: Would be useful to access the parent issue of a sub-task on the rapid board by clikking on the parent's issue id in the upper left corner of the sub-task card.
fields.summary: accessing parent issue (ticket or story) directly from the sub-task by cliking on a link

fields.description:
Currently we count the number of sprints and then suggest a name like Sprint 7.

We should use a scheme where we parse the last sprint name for numbers and then bump that number.

This would lead to name generation like :

No previous sprint ===> Sprint 1

Sprint 1 ===> Sprint 2

Revenge of the Seth ==> Revenge of the Seth 2

Revenge of the Seth 2 ==> Revenge of the Seth 3

Revenge of the Seth 3 Next Generation ==> Revenge of the Seth 3 Next Generation 2



So rules

* if no previous sprint then Sprint 1
* if parsed a number up to a space then bump that number
* if cant parse number up to a space then called it "previous 2"
fields.summary: As a user I would like smarter sprint naming

fields.description:
When using the rapidboard, I click an issue to bring up the side panel with the issue details.

I go to the description tab, and right click on a link in the description. This causes the edit box to appear and reshuffle all the text. The right click context menu still functions fine, it's just a little jarring, and I don't know if I've accidentally modified the issue description
fields.summary: Right clicking on a link in the issue description from the rapidboard causes the inline edit box to appear

fields.description:
Hello team,
As per Support ticket GHS-4488:

{quote}
Hi Atlassian Support,

In the Rapid Board Kanban "Work" mode, when we move a story/parent that has sub-tasks through the workflow, we'd like to be able to have the option of moving the subtasks to the same workflow status, as long as the subtask workflow and parent workflows support that status.

Right now, when we move a story/parent to "In Progress", the subtasks just sit in the "Open" category.

Thanks,
Bob
{quote}

Please let us know the possibility of implementing this feature request.
Thanks,
fields.summary: Rapid Board - Allow Parent issues to move Subtasks along the workflow

fields.description:
Hello team,
As per Support ticket [GHS-4487|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-4487]:

{quote}
Hi Atlassian Support,

It is a fantastic feature of GreenHopper to progress multiple issues through the workflow at the same time via the Planning Board.

This feature, however, is absent from the Rapid Board for Kanban.

This would make planning and moving issues much faster, especially after they are created in succession.
{quote}

Could you please take a look on this improvement and let us know if this is possible?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Allow Multi-Move of Issues on Kanban Rapid Board

fields.description:
When viewing cycle time charts, weekends are included in the calculations. There should be an option to exclude weekends, if desired.

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: What if the user's timezone does not match the server timezone?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: Is this setting remembered between page views?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: Is it clearly specified when this option is on/off?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What happens to any events that happen in these excluded windows? Will they simply not be displayed/will they be calculated?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What if there are large outliers in the excluded period? Will the chart adjust properly?
A: (x) Not Answered
fields.summary: Add option to exclude weekends from cycle time calculations

fields.description:
Raised on behalf of a customer.

To Do: It is showing all the ‘Open’ status issues
Done: It is showing all the ‘Closed’ issues
In Progress: Between Open and Closed issues.

!image001.png!

In reality, this is not a case. We could have Rapid Board columns mapped with different status, such as Open, Analysis, Development To Do, Development, Test Queue, Testing, Deploy, Done.

1) We must need GreenHopper Project Progress bar gadget to show the progress based on Rapid Board mapping

* Display by Swimlane order (this is ideal)
* or by Quick filter

2) As today, the project progress bar configured with context filter. Is it possible to change the order? For above example, I wanted to show the order;

* 01-Risk-SSS
* 02-Risk-Test
* 03-Risk-WWW     

Is it possible to change this order?

fields.description:
Currently:
On the Task Board and Rapid Board, I can filter by assignee. But the assignee dropdown picker does not allow me to do a search or a type-ahead to quickly find the assignee. When the list of potential assignees is very long, it is cumbersome to select someone far down the list.

Demonstration of this:
http://www.screencast.com/t/bwB6WUy4

Desired:
Enable type-ahead or search in the dropdown picker so I can quickly select the assignee by which I want to filter.
fields.summary: As a Task Board user, I want the "filter by assignee" picker to be easier to use
Add possibility to override enforced ORDER BY statement in rapid board ranking for cases where ORDER BY is hidden in a function

fields.description:
GreenHopper appears to use a global exception handler that reacts to any uncaught exception by showing an error on the rapid board.

We've seen a couple of support requests from users with browser extensions that throw exceptions. In some cases, the errors may be benign and GreenHopper could continue to function normally, but the errors alarm people, and as a result they raise support requests.

This could potentially be caused by any JavaScript that runs within the context of the page: browser extensions, GreaseMonkey scripts, even JIRA plugins or Speakeasy extensions.
fields.summary: As a rapid board user with buggy browser extensions, I don't want exceptions thrown from extensions to break GreenHopper
When starting a Sprint with Time Remaining set to the Sprint tracking statistic, warn if Remaining Estimate is unset (or uninherited from children) for any item

fields.description:
Why is the Agile Gadget modifying my Filter?

We are using a very simple filter to collect tasks for our Scrumteam:
labels = sprint-1217 ORDER BY priority DESC

But when using this filter in the Agile Gadget an additional filter is applied:
filter = SCRUM_NESX AND NOT fixVersion is EMPTY AND project in (AEBS etc...

As we have a lot of Issues and Task that don't have a Fix version set. These issues and tasks will be skipped in the chart. But we see them in the Rapid board.

We are using labels to pick up tasks from our backlog for each planned sprint and the label syntax is Group-YYWW, This method makes it possible for the team to plan work that we collect from a lot of different projects, a part of the teams work is to analyze and to set fixversions and time estimation.
fields.summary: Agile Gadget modifies filter

fields.description:
The work mode offers the possibility to add swimlanes on a per-user basis - this allows us to easily see who's buried in work and who's twiddling their thumbs, waiting for stuff to do.

The plan mode however does not allow us to group things like that. Theres the fancy Sprint bar that allows us to add issues to the next sprint, but we don't know if the added issues (lets say, 40 in total) are distributed evenly (about 4 per dev, with 10 devs) unless we actually start the sprint and switch to the plan mode.

Right now, we use the Planning Board (not the Rapid Board) in Assignee View to pick issues and assign them to a Release Version (<product version>.<sprint>, like 6.0.0.5 for the 5th sprint of version 6.0.0), trying to achieve an evenly distributed work load for each user.
Then we switch to the Rapid Board, define a Quick Filter for that particular version (again, 6.0.0.5 for the example) and apply it to the Plan Mode. 
From there, its the same as just adding issues to a new sprint - but I guess the Plan Mode could do a lot better than that ;)
fields.summary: Add grouping/swimlanes/assignee summary to Plan Mode

fields.description:
Two variations, worst case: 

- With sprint marker at the top of the screen 
- Drag it down past two issues at the top of the backlog 
- Use an instant filter to capture two issues lower below the marker INCLUDING the LAST ISSUE
- Multi select and drag those items above the marker 
- BUG: Count of issues on the marker will increment to 3, not four
- Clear the instant filter 
- BUG: When you hit start sprint you will receive a warning that all issues on the screen will be included in the Sprint and are hidden by the filter (even though none are active) 
- BUG: If you reload the page the marker will jump to the bottom of the screen and the backlog and the two items ranked from the bottom to the top will jump back to the bottom 

Second case: 

- With sprint marker at the top of the screen 
- Drag it down past two issues at the top of the backlog 
- Use an instant filter to capture two issues lower below the marker NOT including the bottom two issues
- Multi select and drag those items above the marker 
- BUG: Count of issues on the marker will increment to 3, not four
- BUG: Clear the instant filter and last item that was in the sprint before the filter was applied will be pushed below the marker 
- BUG: When you hit start sprint you will receive a warning that issues are hidden by the filter (even though none are active), the issue turns out to be the one that was pushed below the marker 
- If you reload the page the marker will jump back to the correct position
fields.summary: Dragging items above the marker when instant filter is on does not work correctly
As a user, following Sprint completion I'd like to see the report of everything that happened automatically

fields.description: The workaround is to rank something which appears to reset whatever internal state is responsible

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-5035].
  {panel}

At the moment, creating and starting a sprint (from the Rapid Board) is based on the "Administer Projects" permission. This does not make much sense for us, as the JIRA/GreenHopper administration is not done by the Scrum team themselves, but they need to be able to manage their sprints on their own.

Therefore, we need to specify which users/groups/project roles are allowed to start a sprint independently from the "Administer Projects" permission.
To be honest, the reliance of GreenHopper on JIRA permission feels often inadequate and I hope that you find a way to manage GreenHopper permissions independently (this relates to GHS-1787, GHS-3928).
As long as this is not possible, maybe there is a way to at least separate starting a sprint from the "Administer Projects" permission? E.g. by adding a "Manage Projects" permission in JIRA that allows some of the things included in the "Administer Projects" permission?
fields.summary: As a JIRA/GH administrator, I would like to be able to specify who is allowed to create and start a sprint independently from the "Administer Projects" JIRA permission

fields.description:
Epic and how to split it to stories

Would it be possible to create epic and split it to stories by using Create Issue with Link -> so hierarcy and relationship would com from Link more easilly
fields.summary: Epic and how to split it to stories

fields.description:
In an open source software company, it's often the case that some company-confidential discussion of business strategy takes place in a "product management" issue, and then actual implementation of a feature/story/use case takes place in linked public issues.  It would be nice to allow someone to rank the private issues, and be able to specify that issues related by a particular link type should receive the same rank.  

There a multiple advantages to these issues being links rather than subtasks:

1) public and private issues can be managed together
2) issues in multiple projects can be managed together
3) there could be multi-level hierarchy (though I'm much less concerned about this)
4) there does not have to be an issue type differentiation between a Feature that is also a subtask of a Story and one that is not.

Currently I'm working around this by using the REST APIs of Jira and Greenhopper to scan for links and rerank linked issues, but it feels like a hack.

My blog about it is here: 
http://agrimmsreality.blogspot.com/2012/04/greenhopper-jira-and-rest.html
fields.summary: I would like the ability to co-rank linked issues

fields.description: Somehow the displayed date is in the user timezone (+10), but the 10 is also added to the actual time. Shows 9pm for me instead of 11am. Final result stored is 9pm+10, so the bug is around calculating/filling in the correct date at the start, not in the storage (imo)
fields.summary: Sprint start dialog fills in incorrect start/end date
SAP DefaultBoardIssue Optimization
SAP IssueFieldServiceImpl Optimization - Dont perform sort on fields when its not required

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-5022].
  {panel}

Hi all,

here is the use case:
- have a release with 2 sprints
- at the end of sprint 1, 1 story over 2 is completed. When releasing sprint1, the 2nd one is moved to sprint 2. Story 2 is completed in Sprint 2. Velocity graph will count Story 2 in both Sprint 1 and Sprint 2

For that:
- create a version hierarchy with
- 1 parent version : Release 1
- 2 child versions : Sprint 1, Sprint 2
- Create 2 stories and assign them to Sprint 1:
- Story1 estimated with 5 Story Points
- Story2 estimated with 8 Story Points
- Resolve Story 1
- Release Sprint 1. GreenHopper will propose you to move story 2 in another version. Select Sprint 2
- Resolve Story 2
- Display the velocity graph : go to the chart board, select version "Release 1", Value chart, Story points by children.
- you would expect: 5 points done (Story 1) in Sprint 1, 8 points done (Story 2) in Sprint 2.
- you will see : 13 points done (Story 1 + Story 2) in Sprint 1, 8 points done (Story 2) in sprint 2


thanks to help.

Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: velocity graph is incorrect

fields.description:
When editing issues on the planning board, the board's default behavior is to "follow" the issue that you are editing. This can make working with multiple pages with issues problematic as one must continually flip back to the first page to make the next edit.

One possible workaround is to show more issues on pages, but it would be useful to have an option to turn off the automatic following of edited issues so that work can be completed from the first page if making adjustments to many issues at one time.
fields.summary: Add an option to disable "following" issues while editing them on the planning board
Deleting Business Value field needs to be handled properly

fields.description:
The JIRA team have tweaked (changed) the My JIRA home in 5.1


Martin Meinhold 12:53:07
the link element in the web-item only contains the target url, like:

<link linkId="set_my_jira_home_issuenav">/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa</link>

The actual update url is provided by JIRA itself
so no: /secure/MyJiraHome!Set.jspa?target= 12:54:01


So we need to put in 2 web items (since its not on 5.0.x) and have a condition on them so that only one turns up as appropriate.

As a Scrum Rapid board user I would like to choose to use time/hours or story points.

fields.description:
As a Rapid Board user I would like to be able to see sub-tasks of top level issue types if they are not included in the filter my rapid board is based on.

The main problem being addressed here is that it is not possible to have a filter which includes user stories, but not their tasks and still have the tasks shown on the rapid board.
A actual example of when this is required is the following. A company has X number of development teams that each have a rapid board. Each user story has a 'team' field which is tagged with the team currently working on the user story. The filter the rapid board is based could look something like 'team = "teamname"'. This filter would result in X amount of user stories being listed. With the current solution it isn't possible to list the subtasks of those user stories.

With the planning board this was not an issue as it would filter on fixVersion, which would include the subtasks. 

A workaround for this would be to simply tag the subtasks with the same team as the parent. While this is entirely possible, the hierarchy would break as soon as the team is changed on the parent.

Alternatively the JQL could be more advanced and support queries such as "issuetype = Task AND parent.team='teamname'"
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user I would like to be able to see sub-tasks of top level issue types

fields.description:
Twice I've raised this issue as a bug. The last time Atlassian was able to reproduce it and suggested me to raise it as a change request (https://support.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-4325). 

I would like the dialog window for "Copy sub-tasks" that is shown to the user when an issue is moved from one version to another in Planning View. This give the user the possibility to move parent and child issues to the next version, or to only move parent and explicitly chosen sub-tasks. 

When I've done this using the Task Board as I sometimes do, only the actual issue I'm choosing is being moved, no matter if there are sub-tasks or not. This has several times left me in a position where I have moved the parent issue and forgot about the subtasks. Later on I've had to identify the sub-tasks and move them manually one by one. 

Please consider for later release.
fields.summary: Moving a parent issue between versions using the Task Board should trigger the same function as for the Planning Board - "Include sub-tasks or not"

fields.description: Just to improve the first user experience. Feel free to disagree.
fields.summary: Can the Detail View tabs have Tooltips to describe the icons?

fields.description:
This could be more a feature than a bug. But I find it a bit inconsistent that the sub-task count shrinks to 0 when you hide sub-tasks with Quick Filters. Especially so when you have Issue Counts showing in the column headers and they don't change when the Quick Filter is activated.

We probably need to show both the "Visible" and "Total" counts on the parent swimlanes, like we do on the marker in Plan mode.
fields.summary: Filtering away sub-tasks when Swimlane Strategy is Issues & Subs changes sub-task count to 0?

fields.description: Justification - Although the child was the last thing you dragged the parent was the last thing you operated on and hence is now in context
fields.summary: If we auto move the parent issue then it should be selected not the child issue
Creating a Sprint is not possible in JIRA configured for German because the start date has invalid format.

fields.description:
At the moment Rapid board shows only Issue ID and it's description. That's surely not enough. 

I can't create a "big" project containing several components (sub-projects) because my developers complain that they can not see that what component the issue belongs into. Issue ID doesn't tell anything because it only indicates the main project, not the sub project.

Task board and planning board have nice issue fields. It would bee SUPERB if i get the same information to the rabid board also. I wouldn't need planning board at all then.

Otherwise you have done great job implementing rabid board! 

Acceptance criteria: 
- I can choose the information I want to see directly in rapid board's issue view without first clicking the issue.
fields.summary: As a developer, I want to see more information on Rapid Board's issue

fields.description: - At the bottom of the details tab for now

fields.description:
- The graph is followed by a table that describes the exact timeline shown in the graph: 
  * At each point in time the issue that changed and the values that changed are shown 
  * At time 0 the table lists all issues that were present at the beginning of the graph 
  * At time <end> the table lists all issues that were remaining
fields.summary: Implement Data Table for Burndown chart
